title: Major roads in the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia
text:
Highways and main roads in the <a href="Wheatbelt%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Wheatbelt region</a> of <a href="Western%20Australia">Western Australia</a> form the basis of a road network, which is primarily used by the mining, agriculture, and tourism industries. <a href="Main%20Roads%20Western%20Australia">Main Roads Western Australia</a> maintains and controls these major roads, with offices based in <a href="Northam%2C%20Western%20Australia">Northam</a> and <a href="Narrogin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Narrogin</a>.
There are six main highways through the Wheatbelt that radiate out from Perth:
A network of main roads connects towns within the Wheatbelt to each other, the highways, and neighbouring regions, with local roads providing additional links and access to smaller townsites. Roads are often named after the towns they connect.
Albany Highway.
Albany Highway is a main north-west to south-east highway in the southern Wheatbelt, close to or just outside the region's western edge. It passes through the towns of North Bannister, Crossman, Williams, and Arthur River.
Arthur Road.
Arthur Road is a major east-west road linking <a href="Arthur%20River%2C%20Western%20Australia">Arthur River</a> and <a href="Wagin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wagin</a>, near the southern edge of the Wheatbelt. The western terminus is at <a href="%23Albany%20Highway">Albany Highway</a>, and the eastern terminus is at <a href="%23Great%20Southern%20Highway">Great Southern Highway</a>. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23107">State Route 107</a>, which continues west to <a href="Bunbury%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bunbury</a> and east to <a href="Lake%20King%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake King</a>.
Bindoon Moora Road.
Bindoon Moora Road (also referred to as Bindoon–Moora Road or Moora Bindoon Road) is a major north-south road from <a href="Bindoon%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bindoon</a> to <a href="Moora%2C%20Western%20Australia">Moora</a>, in the northern Wheatbelt. The southern terminus is at <a href="%23Great%20Northern%20Highway">Great Northern Highway</a> north of the Bindoon townsite, and the northern terminus is at the outskirts of Moora, with the route continuing into the town centre as Padbury Street. It is the southern section of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23116">State Route 116</a>, which continues north-west to <a href="Dongara%2C%20Western%20Australia">Dongara</a>.
Brand Highway.
Brand Highway is a main north-west to south-east highway in the northern Wheatbelt, parallel to the coast. From <a href="Muchea%2C%20Western%20Australia">Muchea</a>, it travels in a north-westerly direction, passing to the west of <a href="Gingin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Gingin</a>, and through <a href="Cataby%2C%20Western%20Australia">Cataby</a> and <a href="Badgingarra%2C%20Western%20Australia">Badgingarra</a>. Shortly after the turnoff to <a href="Jurien%20Bay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Jurien Bay</a>, it leaves the Wheatbelt region.
Brookton Corrigin Road.
Brookton Corrigin Road is a major east-west road between <a href="Brookton%2C%20Western%20Australia">Brookton</a> and <a href="Corrigin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Corrigin</a> in the Wheatbelt. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%2340">State Route 40</a>, which links south-eastern <a href="Perth">Perth</a> to <a href="Ravensthorpe%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ravensthorpe</a>.
Brookton Highway.
Brookton Highway is a highway between the south-east of Perth and the Wheatbelt town of <a href="Brookton%2C%20Western%20Australia">Brookton</a>. It passes through <a href="Westdale%2C%20Western%20Australia">Westdale</a> on the way.
Bruce Rock Merredin Road.
Bruce Rock Merredin Road is a major north-south road between <a href="Bruce%20Rock%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bruce Rock</a> and <a href="Merredin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Merredin</a> in the eastern Wheatbelt.
Bruce Rock Quairading Road.
Bruce Rock Merredin Road is a major east-west road between <a href="Bruce%20Rock%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bruce Rock</a> in the east and <a href="Quairading%2C%20Western%20Australia">Quairading</a> in the west. It passes through <a href="Yoting%2C%20Western%20Australia">Yoting</a> and <a href="Kwolyin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kwolyin</a>. It runs parallel to <a href="%23Great%20Eastern%20Highway">Great Eastern Highway</a>, but further south.
Bullfinch Road.
Bullfinch Road is a major road in the eastern Wheatbelt, travelling in a north-westerly direction from <a href="Southern%20Cross%2C%20Western%20Australia">Southern Cross</a> to <a href="Bullfinch%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bullfinch</a>.
Calingiri Road.
Calingiri Road is a major east-west road in the northern Wheatbelt, connecting <a href="Calingiri%2C%20Western%20Australia">Calingiri</a> to <a href="%23Great%20Northern%20Highway">Great Northern Highway</a>, <a href="Wannamal%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wannamal</a>.
Calingiri Wongan Hills Road.
Calingiri Wongan Hills Road is a major north-east to south-west road in the northern Wheatbelt, between <a href="Calingiri%2C%20Western%20Australia">Calingiri</a> and <a href="Wongan%20Hills%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wongan Hills</a>.
Coalfields Road.
Coalfields Road, also known as Coalfields Highway, is a major east-west road near the southern edge of the Wheatbelt. From <a href="%23Albany%20Highway">Albany Highway</a>, <a href="Arthur%20River%2C%20Western%20Australia">Arthur River</a>, the road heads west via <a href="Darkan%2C%20Western%20Australia">Darkan</a> towards <a href="Collie%2C%20Western%20Australia">Collie</a> in the state's <a href="South%20West%20%28Western%20Australia%29">South West region</a>. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23107">State Route 107</a>, which continues west to <a href="Bunbury%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bunbury</a> and east to <a href="Lake%20King%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake King</a>.
Main Roads Western Australia identifies the section west of Collie as H45 Coalfields Highway, and the rest as part of M37 Collie–Lake King Road.
Collie Williams Road.
Collie Williams Road is a major road near the south-western edge of the Wheatbelt. Starting at the <a href="%23Pinjarra%20Williams%20Road">Pinjarra Williams Road</a>, west of the <a href="Williams%2C%20Western%20Australia">Williams</a> townsite, the road heads in a south-westerly direction towards <a href="Collie%2C%20Western%20Australia">Collie</a>, in the state's <a href="South%20West%20%28Western%20Australia%29">South West region</a>.
Corrigin Kondinin Road.
Corrigin Kondinin Road is a major road between the Wheatbelt towns of <a href="Corrigin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Corrigin</a> and <a href="Kondinin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kondinin</a>. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%2340">State Route 40</a>, which links south-eastern <a href="Perth">Perth</a> to <a href="Ravensthorpe%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ravensthorpe</a>.
Corrigin Kulin Road.
Corrigin Kulin Road is a major north-south road in the Wheatbelt. It is the southern section of the route between <a href="Corrigin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Corrigin</a> and <a href="Kulin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kulin</a>. The northern terminus is in <a href="Gorge%20Rock%2C%20Western%20Australia">Gorge Rock</a>, at <a href="%23Corrigin%20Kondinin%20Road">Corrigin Kondinin Road</a>, which continues north-west to Corrigin.
Dumbleyung Lake Grace Road.
Dumbleyung Lake Grace Road is a major east-west road linking <a href="Dumbleyung%2C%20Western%20Australia">Dumbleyung</a> and <a href="Lake%20Grace%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake Grace</a>, near the southern edge of the Wheatbelt. The road passes to the north of <a href="Kukerin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kukerin</a> near the halfway point. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23107">State Route 107</a>, which continues west to <a href="Bunbury%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bunbury</a> and east to <a href="Lake%20King%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake King</a>.
Goomalling Toodyay Road.
Goomalling Toodyay Road is a major north-east to south-west road between <a href="Goomalling%2C%20Western%20Australia">Goomalling</a> and <a href="Toodyay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Toodyay</a>, in the northern Wheatbelt.
The Main Roads designation M60 Goomalling Toodyay Road also includes Railway Terrace and Lockyer Street in Goomalling.
Goomalling Wyalkatchem Road.
Goomalling Toodyay Road is a major east-west road in the northern Wheatbelt. It travels from <a href="Goomalling%2C%20Western%20Australia">Goomalling</a> to <a href="Wyalkatchem%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wyalkatchem</a> via <a href="Dowerin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Dowerin</a>, and was previously known as Goomalling Merredin Road.
Great Eastern Highway.
Great Eastern Highway is the main east-west highway through the centre of the Wheatbelt. From the eastern edge of Perth just past <a href="The%20Lakes%2C%20Western%20Australia">The Lakes</a>, it heads east, bypassing <a href="Northam%2C%20Western%20Australia">Northam</a>, and continuing through <a href="Merredin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Merredin</a> and <a href="Southern%20Cross%2C%20Western%20Australia">Southern Cross</a> towards the <a href="Goldfields-Esperance">goldfields</a>.
Great Northern Highway.
Great Northern Highway is a main highway in the northern Wheatbelt, and part of the Perth to Darwin national highway. From the north-eastern edge of Perth, the highway travels north through <a href="Muchea%2C%20Western%20Australia">Muchea</a>, <a href="Bindoon%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bindoon</a>, and <a href="New%20Norcia%2C%20Western%20Australia">New Norcia</a>. It then heads generally north-easterly, to <a href="Dalwallinu%2C%20Western%20Australia">Dalwallinu</a>, <a href="Wubin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wubin</a>, and into the <a href="Midwest%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Midwest region</a> beyond.
Great Southern Highway.
Great Southern Highway is a major north-south road in the southern Wheatbelt. From <a href="The%20Lakes%2C%20Western%20Australia">The Lakes</a> at the eastern edge of Perth, the highway travels east to <a href="York%2C%20Western%20Australia">York</a>, along a road previously known as Chidlow York Road. It then heads south through <a href="Beverley%2C%20Western%20Australia">Beverley</a>, <a href="Brookton%2C%20Western%20Australia">Brookton</a>, <a href="Narrogin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Narrogin</a>, and <a href="Wagin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wagin</a>.
Hyden Lake King Road.
Hyden Lake King Road is a major road between the Wheatbelt towns of <a href="Hyden%2C%20Western%20Australia">Hyden</a> and <a href="Lake%20King%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake King</a>. From Hyden, the road travels east past <a href="Wave%20Rock">Wave Rock</a>, and then south-east to <a href="Holt%20Rock%2C%20Western%20Australia">Holt Rock</a>, <a href="Varley%2C%20Western%20Australia">Varley</a>, and Lake King. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%2340">State Route 40</a>, which links south-eastern <a href="Perth">Perth</a> to <a href="Ravensthorpe%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ravensthorpe</a>.
Indian Ocean Drive.
Indian Ocean Drive is a main north-west to south-east coastal road in the northern Wheatbelt. From the intersection of <a href="Wanneroo%20Road">Wanneroo Road</a> and Gingin Brook Road in <a href="Woodridge%2C%20Western%20Australia">Woodridge</a>, it travels past turn-offs to <a href="Guilderton%2C%20Western%20Australia">Guilderton</a>, <a href="Seabird%2C%20Western%20Australia">Seabird</a>, <a href="Ledge%20Point%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ledge Point</a>, and <a href="Lancelin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lancelin</a>. Further north it travels past <a href="The%20Pinnacles%20%28Western%20Australia%29">The Pinnacles</a> and <a href="Cervanties%2C%20Western%20Australia">Cervanties</a> to <a href="Jurien%20Bay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Jurien Bay</a>. North of Jurien Bay, it leaves the Wheatbelt region, heading towards <a href="Dongara%2C%20Western%20Australia">Dongara</a> in the state's <a href="Mid%20West%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Mid West region</a>.
A December 2010 proposal to rename Wanneroo Road to Indian Ocean Drive, from Gingin Brook Road south to Yanchep Beach Road, was unsuccessful.
Jurien Road.
Jurien Road, also known as Jurien East Road, is a major east-west road near the northern edge of the Wheatbelt, linking the coastal town of <a href="Jurien%20Bay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Jurien Bay</a> with the <a href="%23Brand%20Highway">Brand Highway</a> at <a href="Hill%20River%2C%20Western%20Australia">Hill River</a>.
Kondinin Hyden Road.
Kondinin Hyden Road is a major east-west road in the Wheatbelt, connecting <a href="Kondinin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kondinin</a> to <a href="Hyden%2C%20Western%20Australia">Hyden</a> via <a href="Karlgarin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Karlgarin</a>. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%2340">State Route 40</a>, which links south-eastern <a href="Perth">Perth</a> to <a href="Ravensthorpe%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ravensthorpe</a>.
Kulin Lake Grace Road.
Kulin Lake Grace Road is a major road between <a href="Kulin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kulin</a> and <a href="Lake%20Grace%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake Grace</a> in the Wheatbelt.
Lake Grace Newdegate Road.
Lake Grace Newdegate Road is a major east-west road linking <a href="Lake%20Grace%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake Grace</a> and <a href="Newdegate%2C%20Western%20Australia">Newdegate</a>, near the southern edge of the Wheatbelt. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23107">State Route 107</a>, which continues west to <a href="Bunbury%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bunbury</a> and east to <a href="Lake%20King%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake King</a>.
Merredin–Nungarin Road.
Merredin–Nungarin Road, also known as Merredin Nungarin Road or Nungarin Merredin Road, is a major north-south road in the eastern Wheatbelt. It travels from <a href="Merredin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Merredin</a> to <a href="Nungarin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Nungarin</a>, and was previously known as Goomalling Merredin Road.
Midlands Road.
Midlands Road, also known as The Midlands Road, is a major road in the northern Wheatbelt. From <a href="%23Great%20Northern%20Highway">Great Northern Highway</a> at <a href="Walebing%2C%20Western%20Australia">Walebing</a>, the road travels west to <a href="Moora%2C%20Western%20Australia">Moora</a> and then north to <a href="Watheroo%2C%20Western%20Australia">Watheroo</a>. Beyond Watheroo, it continues north into the state's <a href="Mid%20West%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Mid West region</a>. The section from Moora northwards is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23116">State Route 116</a>, which continues south to <a href="Bindoon%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bindoon</a> and north-west to <a href="Dongara%2C%20Western%20Australia">Dongara</a>.
Mullewa–Wubin Road.
Mullewa–Wubin Road, also known as Mullewa Wubin Road, is a major road near the northern edge of the Wheatbelt. From <a href="%23Great%20Northern%20Highway">Great Northern Highway</a> at <a href="Wubin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wubin</a>, the road heads north-west into the state's <a href="Mid%20West%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Mid West region</a>, towards <a href="Latham%2C%20Western%20Australia">Latham</a>, <a href="Perenjori%2C%20Western%20Australia">Perenjori</a>, <a href="Morawa%2C%20Western%20Australia">Morawa</a>, and <a href="Mullewa%2C%20Western%20Australia">Mullewa</a>.
Newdegate Ravensthorpe Road.
Newdegate Ravensthorpe Road is a major road near the southern edge of the Wheatbelt. From <a href="Newdegate%2C%20Western%20Australia">Newdegate</a>, it travels east to <a href="Lake%20King%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake King</a>, and then south towards <a href="Ravensthorpe%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ravensthorpe</a>, in the state's <a href="Great%20Southern%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Great Southern region</a>. The east-west section is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23107">State Route 107</a>, which continues west to <a href="Bunbury%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bunbury</a>, while the north-south section is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%2340">State Route 40</a>, which links south-eastern <a href="Perth">Perth</a> to Ravensthorpe.
Northam York Road.
Northam York Road, also known as Northam–York Road, is a major north-south road in the central Wheatbelt, linking <a href="Northam%2C%20Western%20Australia">Northam</a> and <a href="York%2C%20Western%20Australia">York</a>, with the southern half of the route running alongside the <a href="Avon%20River%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Avon River</a>. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23120">State Route 120</a>, which continues north to <a href="Toodyay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Toodyay</a> and south to <a href="Cranbrook%2C%20Western%20Australia">Cranbrook</a>.
Northam–Pithara Road.
Northam–Pithara Road, also known as Northam Pithara Road, is a major north-south road in the northern Wheatbelt. The road links <a href="%23Great%20Eastern%20Highway">Great Eastern Highway</a> at <a href="Northam%2C%20Western%20Australia">Northam</a> with <a href="%23Great%20Northern%20Highway">Great Northern Highway</a> at <a href="Pithara%2C%20Western%20Australia">Pithara</a>. Along the way, it travels through the towns of <a href="Goomalling%2C%20Western%20Australia">Goomalling</a>, <a href="Wongan%20Hills%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wongan Hills</a>, and <a href="Ballidu%2C%20Western%20Australia">Ballidu</a>. It forms the majority of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23115">State Route 115</a>, which continues south into the centre of Northam along Goomalling Road and Taylor Street.
Northam–Toodyay Road.
Northam–Toodyay Road, also known as Northam Toodyay Road, is a major north-west to south-east road in the central Wheatbelt, linking <a href="%23Great%20Eastern%20Highway">Great Eastern Highway</a>, <a href="Northam%2C%20Western%20Australia">Northam</a> with <a href="%23Toodyay%20Road">Toodyay Road</a> in <a href="Toodyay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Toodyay</a>. It is the northern section of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23120">State Route 120</a>, which continues south-east through Northam along Newcastle Road, Fitzgerald Street, and <a href="%23Peel%20Terrace">Peel Terrace</a>. Beyond Northam, State Route 120 travels south to <a href="Cranbrook%2C%20Western%20Australia">Cranbrook</a> via <a href="York%2C%20Western%20Australia">York</a> and other towns on the <a href="%23Great%20Southern%20Highway">Great Southern Highway</a>.
Nungarin–Wyalkatchem Road.
Nungarin–Wyalkatchem Road, also known as Nungarin Wyalkatchem Road or Wyalkatchem Nungarin Road, is a major east-west road in the northern Wheatbelt. It travels from <a href="Nungarin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Nungarin</a> to <a href="Wyalkatchem%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wyalkatchem</a> via <a href="Kununoppin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kununoppin</a> and <a href="Trayning%2C%20Western%20Australia">Trayning</a>. It was previously known as Goomalling Merredin Road.
Peel Terrace.
Peel Terrace is a major road within <a href="Northam%2C%20Western%20Australia">Northam, Western Australia</a>. It starts as the continuation of Forrest Road at the <a href="Avon%20River%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Avon River</a>. It crosses the river near the Northam Weir, and travels in an east-south-easterly direction. The first major intersection is with Fitzgerald Street and Taylor Street, which is controlled by traffic lights. It continues in a straight line, alongside the railway line, until it intersect Yilgarn Avenue and York Road. Yilgarn Avenue leads to <a href="%23Great%20Eastern%20Highway">Great Eastern Highway</a>, while York Road continues south to <a href="%23Northam%20York%20Road">Northam York Road</a>.
South-east of Fitzgerald Street, the road is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23120">State Route 120</a>, which links <a href="Toodyay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Toodyay</a> in the north with <a href="Cranbrook%2C%20Western%20Australia">Cranbrook</a> in the south. The route continues through Northam along Fitzgerald Street and Newcastle Road northbound, towards <a href="%23Northam%E2%80%93Toodyay%20Road">Northam–Toodyay_Road</a>, and along York Road to Northam York Road.
Main Roads Western Australia controls the section south-east of Fitzgerald Street, which was part Great Eastern Highway's former route, prior to the construction of the <a href="Great%20Eastern%20Highway%23Bypasses">Northam bypass</a>. The highway formerly continued east along Yilgarn Avenue, and west along Fitzgerald Street, Newcastle Road, and Mitchell Avenue.
Pingrup Lake Grace Road.
Pingrup Lake Grace Road is a major road near the southern edge of the Wheatbelt. Starting at the <a href="Lake%20Grace%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake Grace</a>, the road heads south towards <a href="Pingrup%2C%20Western%20Australia">Pingrup</a>, in the state's <a href="Great%20Southern%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Great Southern region</a>.
Pinjarra Williams Road.
Pinjarra Williams Road is a major road near the south-western edge of the Wheatbelt. Starting from <a href="%23Albany%20Highway">Albany Highway</a> at <a href="Williams%2C%20Western%20Australia">Williams</a>, the road heads west to <a href="Quindanning%2C%20Western%20Australia">Quindanning</a>, and then continues in a north-westerly direction into the state's <a href="Peel%20%28Western%20Australia%29">Peel region</a>, towards <a href="Pinjarra%2C%20Western%20Australia">Pinjarra</a>.
Quairading–York Road.
Quairading–York Road, also known as Quairading York Road, is a major east-west road in the central Wheatbelt. It travels between <a href="Quairading%2C%20Western%20Australia">Quairading</a> and <a href="York%2C%20Western%20Australia">York</a>, via <a href="Mawson%2C%20Western%20Australia">Mawson</a>.
Southern Cross–Marvel Loch Road.
Southern Cross–Marvel Loch Road, also known as Southern Cross Marvel Loch Road, is a major road in the eastern Wheatbelt. From <a href="%23Great%20Eastern%20Highway">Great Eastern Highway</a> at <a href="Southern%20Cross%2C%20Western%20Australia">Southern Cross</a>, it travels in a south-easterly direction to <a href="Marvel%20Loch%2C%20Western%20Australia">Marvel Loch</a>.
Toodyay Road.
Toodyay Road is a major road from Perth into the northern Wheatbelt. From <a href="Morangup%2C%20Western%20Australia">Morangup</a>, just outside <a href="Perth">Perth</a>'s north-eastern edge, the road travels in a north-easterly direction to <a href="Toodyay%2C%20Western%20Australia">Toodyay</a>. It is allocated <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%2350">State Route 50</a>.
Tonkin Highway.
Tonkin Highway provides the lone <a href="freeway">freeway</a>-standard road in the region, connecting Perth to both <a href="Brand%20Highway">Brand Highway</a> and <a href="Great%20Northern%20Highway">Great Northern Highway</a>. It travels from just outside <a href="Perth">Perth</a>'s north-eastern edge to <a href="Muchea%2C%20Western%20Australia">Muchea</a>. It is allocated <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%234">State Route 4</a>.
Wagin Dumbleyung Road.
Wagin Dumbleyung Road is a major east-west road linking <a href="Wagin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wagin</a> and <a href="Dumbleyung%2C%20Western%20Australia">Dumbleyung</a>, near the southern edge of the Wheatbelt. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%23107">State Route 107</a>, which continues west to <a href="Bunbury%2C%20Western%20Australia">Bunbury</a> and east to <a href="Lake%20King%2C%20Western%20Australia">Lake King</a>.
Wanneroo Road.
Wanneroo Road is a major road from Perth into the northern Wheatbelt. From <a href="Wilbinga%2C%20Western%20Australia">Wilbinga</a>, just outside <a href="Perth">Perth</a>'s north-eastern edge, the road travels northwards to the intersection of <a href="%23Indian%20Ocean%20Drive">Indian Ocean Drive</a> and Gingin Brook Road in <a href="Woodridge%2C%20Western%20Australia">Woodridge</a>. It is part of <a href="List%20of%20road%20routes%20in%20Western%20Australia%2360">State Route 60</a>, which continues south to <a href="Perth%20%28suburb%29">Perth's central business district</a> (CBD), and north to <a href="Brand%20Highway">Brand Highway</a> near Dongara.
A December 2010 proposal to rename Wanneroo Road to Indian Ocean Drive, between Gingin Brook Road and Yanchep Beach Road, was unsuccessful.
Williams Kondinin Road.
Williams Kondinin Road is a major road between the Wheatbelt towns of <a href="Williams%2C%20Western%20Australia">Williams</a> and <a href="Kondinin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kondinin</a>. From Williams, the road travels north-east to <a href="Narrogin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Narrogin</a> and <a href="Wickepin">Wickepin</a>, then east to <a href="Jitarning%2C%20Western%20Australia">Jitarning</a>. It continues north-east to Kondinin, via <a href="Kulin%2C%20Western%20Australia">Kulin</a>.
